review:
The good:
+ Gorgeous visual which fit surreal landscape.
+ Native linux support.
+ OKish much, even though ti's overshadowed overshadowed by the visual.

- Steam FPS counter say the game run in 75 FPS, but i feel like it's locked-in to 30 FPS or lower.

* Awkward keyboard/mouse control. The possible 30 FPS lock-in makes it worse, although still playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1633950605}
review: Tulpa is a mixture between a 2D platformer and a point-and-click adventure, with a heavy focus on puzzle solving. Basically, you play as 2 characters, and you can swap control at any time. One of them is physical, and can push and pull things, and the other is ghostly, so he floats and interacts with far objects using the mouse. It’s an interesting idea, but I don’t think the 2 genres blend well. Switching from a more standard platforming to a point and click style, where you need to search for the interactable objects isn’t smooth. But since this is more focused on the puzzle elements, it’s not a big deal. Just a bit awkward. There’s a lot of variety in the puzzles, but some of them are unintuitive and frustrating, because a lot of times you are supposed to figure out how the puzzle is supposed to work. A lot of times I progressed through trial and error or by clicking on stuff by accident. And that isn’t a sign of good design, like here are the rules, now solve the stuff. It has a lot of out-of-box thinking, but mostly not in a good way. Still, it’s a short and enjoyable experience, if you can get it for cheap.

review: This game feels more like a passion project rather than a marketable game. There is nothing wrong with it per se, but a lot of things are feeling off. From the rather unnerving atmosphere, the shortage of music, the eeriness of sound design, the "floaty" controls (which is ironic given that, you know, one of the characters you control literally floats), short run time, even to the fact that the devs made up an alphabet from scratch for just three-four occurences in-game, it feels rather unpolished, but made with the sole purposed of not being enjoyable, but to try and get to know the feeling of grief (at least their abstract version of it). All in all, this is a game about pain and loss, which is a short journey, but maybe not in the way you expect it to be.

Tulpa - ходилка в сторону с решением физических задачек преодоления препятствий на пути.

Плюсы
+ Короткая, на 90 минут
+ Цветастая, как аппликация
+ Имеет силовой и ментальный подходы к решению проблем
+ "Милая" смерть
+ Весело жонглировать висельниками

- Некоторые задачки решаются тыком/перебором, а не применением логики
- Баги, препятствующие продвижению
- Запомнится разве что совой да цветами

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198117427910', 'num_games_owned': 1474, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1603641609}
review:
Тульпа — це, по суті, вигадане паранормальне явище або ж уявна форма містицизму. Термін прийшов з буддизму і, щоби отримати тульпу, просто уявити якусь річ не можна. Тульпа — це добре продуманий до деталей суб’єкт, здебільшого це людина чи особистість, іноді просто людське єство. І це не вигадка на кілька хвилин чи днів, а довготривала ідея, яка стає частиною свідомості. Простіше кажучи, буддисти медитували, опановували свої техніки, і в своїх глибоких (або й не дуже) роздумах на рівні галюцинацій створювали такі тульпи.

Сьогодні ж тульпа використовується для створення уявного друга або ж другого "я". Це можна спостерігати в однойменній грі. Офелія (Отелія) вигадала Олівера, разом з яким вона подорожує своїм моторошним світом думок, сповненим символізму. Олівер настільки міцно зв’язався зі свідомістю дівчини, що та вже не може без нього існувати, інакше вона втратить ті залишки глузду і помре. Розробники кажуть, що відштовхувалися від концептів теософії та окультизму.

Загалом мені сподобалося, як виглядає гра. Нагадує Limbo, але кольорово і набагато приємніше оку. Платформер містить головоломки, іноді гра намагається налякати гравця. Також мені сподобалася кінцівка гри, є відчуття завершення після проходження.

Відсутня українська локалізація, а сама гра коротка (десь на півтори години).

Висновок: не раджу купувати, але гра нівроку.

review: I will review this as a piece of art. The lack of context will make your fantasy flourish in very obscure ways, like it would when reading a book. It will probably (preferably) throw your mind in the same state a psychological thriller does, and the lack of textures will create a feeling of a barren and harsh world, which is the ultimate purpose of this game. You have to pay attention to the small details as well as the deeper meaning which is not so straightforward if taken lightly. This raw impression of art, often opens pathways to ultimately understand the subconscious mind of the creator. I personally relate this game to the anxiety of loss and the disturbance of the balance in the mind due to trauma. Especially the final puzzles could be interpreted as the heavy conflict of the inner psyche, since their paranoid nature (the hallucinations) reflect the mind's inability adapting to an inert and impossibly hard world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028769894', 'num_games_owned': 1844, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1598010857}
review:
Visually and sound-wise it's great, story while minimal is pretty alright as well. It has a nice psychedelic, horror, dream-like atmosphere throughout. With some well made, stylized characters and environments.
Though while incredibly short, for a small price would be still a pleasant experience.

IF it wasn't for the technical mess that this game is, the tutorial cart push and jump from it was so messed up it was probably the place I was stuck at the longest, since I thought I was missing something or doing something wrong, but nope, suddenly the character grabbed the ledge, when she wouldn't the first 30 times. Despite it being simple and short, it's an absolute bugfest, many jumps just don't register if there is a slight slope starting, which is the most infuriating problem in the game, the objects' physics sometimes mess up in weird ways, the mouse press in a timed trap also doesn't register sometimes, when switching characters after a jump, the Ophelia girl sometimes just phases through terrain and just hangs on a ledge that is half a meter away from where she is, and also if you alt-tab on some transitions - it will soft-lock the game.

It's a shame really, since other aspects of the game are good, maybe besides how easy a lot of the puzzles are. If despite how little this game was sold and played, the devs make a game in similar style, but with either better engine, or code (whichever failed here), I think it could be a nice moody quality time.

review:
This is a 2D retro indie puzzle platformer with a horror/surrealist theme.  Like hundreds of other platformers, this one relies on a couple of gimmicks in an attempt to justify a position on the Steam store.   Just kidding, Valve will let pretty much anything onto Steam.    But the gimmick part is true.  This one has the "Foreground is dark but background has colour" gimmick that I've seen literally dozens of times, and the "control two characters and switch characters as part of some puzzles" gimmick. 

Overall there's nothing new here.  Tired old puzzle platformer mechanics, lazy graphics (at least they're not pixel art?).  The art theme is interesting here and it might have had some hope if they'd put some real development effort in and made a proper game instead of yet another 2d retro platformer.   Not worth $4.50.

review:
Tulpa is a very beautiful puzzle game. It deals about loss, but only through the moody music, imagery and symbolism - there is no storyline at all. The gameplay itself is just basic puzzle solving. There is virtually no platforming skills involved in Tulpa. Most puzzles aren't that hard to solve, so you can easily finish within 2 hours of gameplay. Getting all the Steam achievements, takes another playthrough, which immediately makes it very clear that the game has no replay value. If you feel stuck, most of the time you can simply solve the puzzle by systematically trying to interact with every element you see on screen. Some puzzles require putting items in the correct order, and you can simply resort to brute-forcing the solution by trying out all possible arrangements.

Although I recommend the game, it think it is suitable mainly for people who like puzzle games in general, and only at a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265253691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1574517544}
review:
Bien... ça fait longtemps que je voulais essayer ce jeu et j'ai enfin pris le temps.
Etant tulpamancien depuis des année forcément le thème du jeu ma incité a mi intéresser.
Sauf que je ne vois aucun rapport avec la tulpamancie d'une quelconque façon.
Ce que je vois c'est un truc abstrait et dérangeant plus ou moins interactif qui ne veux rien dire et qui ne raconte rien.
La tulpamancie étant incompris déjà je pense que l'on aurait pue ce passé d'une telle daube qui encourage encore plus les préjugé "de comme quoi on est des taré mal saint"
Et pourquoi le message a la fin montre Olivier (Le tulpa) ce suicidé...
Les propos du jeu vis-a-vis de la tulpamancie, je les considère comme étant toxic.

Mais bon ce n'est pas tous en terme de jeu qu'est ce que ça vaut.
Le jeu est graphiquement pas vilain mais "limbo" principal inspiration du jeu était plus belle et sortie presque 10 ans avant "tulpa"
La physique du jeu et les contrôle sont on ne peut plus archaïque.
Genre quand un objet tombe il ce met a saccade dans ça chute.
Le jeu est aussi très mal optimiser vue que là je suis sur une machine de guerre mais a l'époque je jouais sur un PC portable quand même plutôt haut de gamme.
Mais il le fesait surchauffé et plantais au bout de 15 minutes a chaque fois (Raison pour la quelle je n'avais pas pue y jouer avant)
L'ambiance sonore est passable on dirait de la musique de relaxation.
Et le gameplay en gros il faut avancer dans un couloir et résoudre des énigmes percher dont je n'ai pas compris la logique les 3 quart du temps mais bon, ça a fini par passé quand même.
Et la duré de vie c'est 1h20, donc très court.

Conclusion aucune raison de jouer a ce jeu !

author: {'steamid': '76561198041248461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1441457265}
review:
Gioco sviluppato da Encryptique. Il gioco è un puzzle platform 2D, non ce una trama o se ce io non l'ho vista. Noi controlliamo due personaggi, Ophelia che può saltare, arrampicarsi, tirare e spingere leve, in pratica la parte platform del gioco è nelle sue mani e Oliver che può interagire con alcuni elementi dello scenario. Il gameplay ruota tutto attorno alla cooperazione dei due personaggi, il gioco spiega l'essenziale dei comandi che però sono a volte imprecisi. Per avanzare nel gioco dobbiamo risolvere alcune fasi platform e dei puzzle, peccato che questi puzzle sono fatti male, o sono troppo semplici e scontati o la soluzione è senza una logica precisa, infatti la maggior parte dei puzzle si risolve per tentativi alla cieca o senza sapere come hai fatto, si muore spesso nel tentativo di risolvere un puzzle per poi scoprire una soluzione del tutto insensata. A livello tecnico l'unica cosa che si salva del gioco e il suo stile grafico ben fatto. Il gioco aveva del potenziale visto la cooperazione dei due personaggi e la grafica bella da vedere, ma viene affossato da puzzle veramente mediocri e frustranti, fortunatamente dura poco dalle 2 alle 4 ore dipende se riuscite a capire i vari puzzle o se avete fortuna nel risolverli.

[b][u]Pro[/u][/b]
+ Stile grafico
+ Alcune buone idee
[b][u]Contro[/u][/b]
- Enigmi fatti male
- Sistema di controllo impreciso

review:
Brawurowe połączenie najgorszych wzorców z przygodówek i platformówek indie. Z pierwszego logika z kosmosu i konieczność klikania na co popadnie bo raczej nie sposób wydumać o co chodzi, z drugiego fizyka skoków, chamskie pułapki które nas zabijają a których nie sposób pierwszy raz się spodziewać i cała otoczka która miała być tajemnicza a jest jak dla mnie po prostu bardzo pretensjonalna. 
Owszem, na pierwszy rzut oka gra proponuje jakiś ciekawy styl wizualny, ale słaba fizyka i animacje postaci psuje efekt. Brak podstawowych opcji jak możliwość zmiany głośności czy brak dostępu do opcji w ogóle w trakcie gry z potrzebą wyjścia do menu głównego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331555490', 'num_games_owned': 1519, 'num_reviews': 900, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1566261621}
review:
여자랑 소울메이트가 환상의 세계를 탐험하는 퍼즐 플랫포머.

장점보다 단점이 매우 많은 게임 중 하나인데, 간단하게 이들을 서술하자면 다음과 같다 :

- 장점 :

1. 기묘한 오브젝트들. 초현실적이나 비정상적인 세계를 배경으로 하는 게임이라 그런지 일반적이지 않은 오브젝트들을 볼 수 있다.

- 단점:

1. 조작감이 겁나 구리다. 점프 조작감 및 미세 컨트롤이 환상적으로 나쁘다. 게임 난이도가 쉬워서 다행이지, 만약 이 조작감으로 하드코어 퍼즐 플랫포머를 만들었다? 아마 엔딩을 보면서 멘탈이 갈갈이 찢겨져 욕설이 가득한 평가를 썼을 것이다.

2. 주인공이랑 소울메이트가 일정 거리 이상 떨어지면 즉사하는 게임 내 메커니즘이 있는데, 이 문제점이 1번의 단점과 환상적인 궁합을 이루어 주인공이 자꾸 이상한 곳에서 죽게 된다. 농담이 아니라 무슨 개복치마냥 펑펑 터지는 주인공을 자주 볼 수 있을 것이다.

3. 게임 내 마우스 감도가 별로여서 옵션을 열었었는데, 놀랍게도 이 게임은 옵션에 소리 끄기와 언어밖에 없다! 마우스 감도 조절은 둘째치고 해상도 조절도 못하는 게임이라니......

4. 게임 스토리는 차라리 예전에 혹평을 했었던 Amphora가 그리울 정도로 있으나 마나 한 스토리이다. 아니, Amphora는 레벨별로 스토리를 이해할 수라도 있었지 이 게임은 그냥 새우깡에 들어있는 진짜 새우 함량급으고 스토리에 대해 알려주는 게 없다.

5. 퍼즐 게임인데 퍼즐이 뭔지 알 수 없다. 비직관적인 퍼즐 때문에 만약 게임을 하다 막히게 된다면, 괜히 이 게임에 머리 싸매면서 시간을 낭비하지 말고 그냥 공략 보는 걸 권장한다.


결론적으로, 도대체 왜 그리고 어떻게 스팀 그린라이트를 통과했는지 모르겠는 재미없는 게임이다. 역시 "복합적" 평가의 게임들은 모 아니면 도라는 교훈을 다시 한 번 떠올리게 하는, 반면교사로써 훌륭한 게임이라고 생각한다.

여담) 그나마 업적과 업적 공략이 있어서 그 쪽에 흥미있는 사람들은 파격할인할 때 사려나...

review:
Tulpa is a 2d, artistic platformer in an already crowded genre. The art style isn't terrible at all, with vibrant colors and striking visuals, but the gameplay is rather spotty. It was relatively quick and I met few bugs on the technical side of things, but the puzzles were more often than not more frustrating then engaging.  Frequently I would find myself knowing what I had to do, but had missed a button to press that would allow me to actually start the puzzle itself. The music and sound effects were bland. The game only consists of about 4 levels separated mostly by color and foreground objects.

It might be worthwhile on steep sale for both the trading cards and easy achievements for those that care about them.

review:
Tulpa is a platformer with an amazing atmosphere kind of like Limbo and a switch between 2 characters aspect like Last Inua. 

Unfortunately, other than the puzzles it's bad:[list][*]The ringing sound that constantly plays still hurts my head while i'm writing this.
[*] The game has no volume sliders or even different sound options, you can only turn all sound on and off. 

[*] Puzzles are non-logical, for instance you have to bring a yellow ball to a ribcage to make an elevator work without any indication of any of this.

[*] Ophelia will go mad within seconds if something bad happens or Oliver strays slightly. 

[*]When controlling one character the other often follows poorly, sometimes too slow, sometimes not at all.

[*]The controls are wonky. Sometimes Oliver won't grab something, sometimes Ophelia doesn't jump.

[*]The tutorial is poorly designed. I died right at the start because there's a little shake just before your first jump and i missed because of it. I also got stuck because the tutorial text introducing Oliver didn't show.

[*]You will die a lot, often for dumb reasons. Respawning is quite slow and you're often placed too far back.

[*]There's no indication of when the game saves and you can't access the options menu during the game.

[*]Did i say options menu? i meant the sound on/off menu. Although you can also choose in which language the game gives you a headache.[/list][b]TL;DR[/b]: Literally and figuratively gives you a headache.

PS: It took me three edits to fix the bold tag because i have a bloody headache.

NB: I played this game for about 17 minutes, the rest is idling for cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993419334', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1533158325}
review:
Tulpa is an abstract game, which is the main reason for playing it. The puzzles, the art, the story (as much as there is; it's mostly up to interpretation) - all of it is drenched in abstractions in ways that are often very creative, if not always practical. If you're looking for a visual stunner with abstract art and somewhat creepy visuals, I would say that this game is worth playing solely for that. The vague storytelling also lends itself pretty well to such imagery, giving you a feel for what the game wants to convey and then sealing the deal with quite a stark ending. In those areas, the game is at its best, and it's pretty impressive for what it is.

However, there are some glaring negatives, and it's all gameplay. The platforming is servicable, but that's pretty much it. There is also little point to it as it mostly exists as a way of getting from puzzle to puzzle. And that's where the problem lies: the puzzles. They are mainly solved by switching to the floating man/ghost, which allows you the use of the mouse to drag or click on objects. However, the quality of the puzzles basically comes down to a coinflip: some of them are pretty good, allowing for some logical thinking; while others have you frantically looking for something to interact with, often finding it hidden somewhere off the screen. It's annoying and unnecessary, feeling like a way to just mess with the player instead of conceiving a puzzle that actually gives an intellectual challenge.

On top of that, you have instant-deaths-from-nowhere, where you encounter something that you haven't seen before, and the way the game signals that it's dangerous is simply by having you die to it. A few times it also springs pure traps on you that are next to impossible to dodge if you don't know that they're already there. Basically, you die way more than necessary, which means spending a lot of time with black loading screens. And that's in a game that is already somewhat short (if not awfully so, as it has a decent pacing to it). Again, it feels more like the developers messing with you than something that you could have dodged if you were just faster/better.

As it stands, I will recommend this game, but I want to note that it's a [b]careful[/b] recommendation. This is not a polished game and really only suitable to people who really like the art. If you're here for gameplay, then I would give this a pass. For those who can overlook some bad puzzles in favor of gorgeus visuals, I would give it a try (even if I would probably pick it up at a sale).

review:
Quite seldom do I find a video game that takes place in a rather surreal world. Tulpa is an example of this where we control a boy and a girl through interesting (and very dangerous) environments. The graphics are quite unique - each chapter (or world) we go through has a different colour and the accompanying atmospheric music / sound is also great.

Ophelia and Oliver must be kept close to one another; we have to use them wisely to bypass the dangers and to solve the puzzles. At times it can be difficult as it is not obvious from the very beginning what we need to do in order to progress (and where do we progress, at all?) and the game rarely provides us with any hints. Also, one rather strange thing is how some of the achievements pertain to either failing puzzles (i.e. dying deliberately) or simply finding certain symbols and clicking on them.

A key emphasis is on symbols; the game revolves around theosophy and the title is a reference to Oliver himself as a thought form. The two children greatly complement each other - while Ophelia can psychically interact with the world Oliver can float around and interact with anything else that is, well, otherworldly. Since Oliver is the projection of Ophelia he must be kept close otherwise she goes insane.

This is a short but all the more interesting and atmospheric puzzle platformer. I haven't played anything like it before so in case you are interested in something unique and extraordinary give Tulpa a chance.

review:
[h1]Recenzja[/h1] 
[i]Tulpa[/i]... psychodeliczny klimat na pograniczu życia i załamania. Łamigłówki w otoczce paranormalnych zjawisk i surrealistycznych krajobrazów. Krótkie przeżycie, aczkolwiek bardzo intensywne.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1183890455 Zapraszam do obserwowania mojej strony [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33268259-Krasny-Feuilleton/]KURATORA[/url], aby być na bieżąco ze wszystkimi recenzjami!

[h1]Fabuła[/h1]
Niniejsza gra rzuca nas w bardzo głęboką otchłań surrealistycznych widoków, które potęgują odczucia i stan świadomości naszej protagonistki Ophelii. Przemierzając niepojętą ścieżką liniowego losu, w pewnej chwili natrafiamy na [i]Tulpę[/i], czyli coś w rodzaju alter ego lub drugiej świadomości żyjącej w naszym 'ja'. Umysł Ophelii wytworzył Oliviera, który wg mnie jest kimś, kogo Ophelia straciła w przeszłości. Postać Olivera bardzo często przejawia się w postaci wisielców, stąd domniemam, że popełnił on samobójstwo. Ophelia nie mogąc się pogodzić, wytworzyła w swojej własnej sferze mentalnej Oliviera, który pomaga jej na ścieżce ku?... w zasadzie donikąd. Jedno jest pewne, że bez niego, Ophelia nie poradziłaby sobie z problemami umysłu, z którymi musi się zmierzyć

[h1]Grywalność[/h1]
Niniejsza gra oferuje nam łamigłówki na dość wysokim poziomie trudności. O ile w sytuacji, gdy potrafimy na prawdę w sposób abstrakcyjny myśleć (tak jak i autor), o tyle łamigłówki będą dla nas łatwiejsze. Ponadto, wiedza na temat działania gier i programowania, niestety troszkę ułatwia ich rozwiązywanie jako, iż jesteśmy w stanie wydedukować to, na co nie pozwala silnik gry. Podążając przez świat pełen surrealistycznych i paranormalnych wizji musimy umiejętnie wykorzystać niewielkie zdolności fizyczne Ophelii oraz 'mentalizm' Tulpy (Oliviera), który posiada umiejętności telekinezy. Jako, że Oliver jest ściśle związany ze świadomością Ophelii, nie może on zbyt daleko od niej odchodzić. Tym bardziej, że Ophelia jest strasznie zżyta z Olivierem, nie jest ona w stanie wytrzymać kilkanaście sekund bez swojego Tulpy. Z tego względu Ophelia ślepo podąża za Olivierem, często wpadając w pułapki i dziury, na co musimy uważać.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1183890561
[h1]Dźwięki[/h1]
Niesamowite przeżycia płynące z gry nadaje jej udźwiękowienie, które jest proste, ale mocno działające na wyobraźnię i psychikę. Zgrzyty, trzaski, jęki powodują narastające poczucie surrealizmu, który wręcz wylewa się z gry. Piękna muzyka pozwala zanurzyć się otchłań gry i wraz z Ophelią przeżyć wszystko to co odbywa się na ekranie.

[h1]Grafika[/h1]
Doskonałe panowanie grafiką wektorową umożliwia rozgrywkę w szerokiej (wręcz nieskończenie wielkiej) gamie rozdzielczości, bez utraty jakości gry. Niesamowita gra kolorów pozwala w każdym poziomie obrócić klimat rozgrywki o 180 stopni. Artysta (myślę, że tak można nazwać rysownika) doskonale obraca się w surrealizmach rysowniczych i wygląda na to, że czuje się w tym jak ryba w wodzie oraz wie na czym to polega. Bardzo pomysłowe lokacje wprawiają w coraz to większe konsternacje. Animacje ładne, choć wiele animacji obiektów ruchomym nie są płynne. Nie przeszkadza to, aczkolwiek wygląda trochę dziwnie (a może tak miało być?).
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1186050398
[h1]Sterowanie[/h1]
Poruszanie postacią jest bardzo proste i intuicyjnie. Chociaż lekką irytację wywołuje dość proste ześlizgiwanie się postaci ze skarp i krawędzi oraz brak reakcji na wyskok (co może być uciążliwe w etapie 'z oczami').

review:
A good puzzle platformer will have some way of explaining the rules as you need them and will not change said rules without fair warning.  The basic concepts should be practical freebies before the player is let loose on more complex puzzles that require application of those basics.  Tulpa does not do this.

After a brief and bare-boned tutorial, Tulpa presented unexplained/inconsistent rules for grabbing objects/solving puzzles, terrible feedback to let the player know if they're doing a puzzle right or not, and what amonts to a whole lot of blind clicking unless you somehow happen to know what the developer was thinking.  Even having grabbable objects be a consistent color would've immensely improved this game, but no, you're literally expected to spot a plank at the edge of the screen that is the exact same color as the ground...

This game isn't fun, it's needlessly frustrating and is likely one of the worst puzzle platformers I've ever played.  If you want a good puzzle platformer, go with Wayforward's remake of A Boy and his Blob.  

AVOID TULPA AT ALL COSTS!

Tags: Adventure - Sidescroll

TLDR: No Xbox360 pad. Clunky, dragged out, boring and bland. Lots of trial and error, moon logic, insta-deaths. The interactivity between user and puzzles strongly suggests at a touch-optimized design. Would rather watch a Lets Play than play it myself.

Puzzle-centric. Your progression gets stuck constantly. Animations for everything are well done however movement for everything you do feel slow and drags the action out even more. The art direction is interesting but the lack of any microtexturing really cheapens the experience. Background and foreground elements are internally consistent with the gameworld and are nicely done. The audio is severely lacking. the atmospheric ambiant track is not so atmospheric at all and reminds me of my graphic's card coil whine. Not much of any sound effect. World setting is not very well explained and the indirect narrative is slow to build and ends up in an arguably nonsensical manner. As far as you are concerned you are a girl that spawns next to a giant tree and have to go through a world of machines and dead people. Probably some symbolic meaning about nature vs industry and the human condition between those two. The game likes to throw ghostlike and demonic like things here and there as well. You meet up with the alternate protag as a random corpse lying on the street just rising up to help you as a floating ghost. The game features some environment manipulation but hotspots are not highlightable and the game often requires you to click, hold, drag, in a very specific manner and direction to get the interaction working successfully. The game has no foes to speak of but instead will introduce dangerous hotspots where you will be dead overtime due to sanity reasons, and also the more common pitfall death. You do not get a lot of freedom when you get your second character as both need to stay together and the second character follows automatically. I found the ending to be reflective of the quality of the rest of the narrative. Improvised and mostly meaningless.

Conclusion: For a similar experience with a better feature set and more refined mechanics I would recommend trying 
http://store.steampowered.com/app/221810/The_Cave/

review:
[h1] Game was bought in a Humble Bundle for 1 dollar[/h1]

Tulpa is a puzzle-platforming game somewhat simillar to Limbo in which you play as a woman named Ophelia and her imaginary friend Oliver.

Theme of the game comes from term Tulpamancy which refers to having imaginary friends and interacting with them, which ties nicely into core gameplay of the game. Story of the game is very barebones and only gives some hints at the end of the game leaving more questions than answers. At the credits game has 2 sets of symbols that may elaborate more on story if one were to decypher it, however lacklucter gameplay didn't make me engaged in wanting to decypher it.

The gameplay consists of Solving puzzles by alternating between both characters. Very soon though game makes you use almost exclusively Oliver for solving puzzles and needing to navigate Ophelia to next Puzzle section. If you are lucky you won't need to do any platforming with Ophelia, which is sluggish and very unresponsive, it may result in you dying, since Ophelia didn't feel like grabbing the ledge. When you manage to reach next section with puzzle, you will be required to use Oliver to interact with objects and environment to progress forward. Puzzles start out mostly straight forward but very soon move unto Trial and Error gameplay and making you pixel hunt in environment to find stuff that is interactible (Game doesn't make clear what can be interacted with). Game also posseses mechanic where if Ophelia and Oliver are separated it will result in them dying. While it is a neat idea, game never uses this mechanic in puzzle solving, which might be for the best since controls probably would've made it annoying, if such puzzles were implemented. Game itself is very short, consistingof 4 small stages and can be beaten in couple of hours depending on how fast you find or stumble upon solution.


[u]In short this is a game that tried to be more of an Artistic Interactive experience. review:
Tulpa is a Limbo-ripoff... - uh, Limbo-homage with decent graphical design, sub-par programming and terrible controls.

There are two characters, each with different "skills", which made me think it'll be like Lost Vikings. However, the characters have to stay together (one will always follow the other) and the "skills" are obvious to use. So, no unique puzzle situations are created out of it.

The good:
- Some of the locations and backgrounds look nice.

The bad:
- Puzzles are unimaginative.
- No story to speak of.
- The game runs awfully.
- The controls are unbelievably bad. It's almost impossible to make the character jump when you want to.

Verdict:
Avoid, even when on sale.

review:
My reviews are usually longer as I like to write more than dry facts about games, but this time I'll make an exception, as Tulpa is so lacking in many ways that it's just not possible to write about it as a game, without dwelving into buddhism and about tulpas.
The game technically a very simple puzzle-platformer - as you go on, you need to use the ghost-like Tulpa's (Oliver)  ability to move items to solve puzzles, and rarely to pull/push something with the main character, Ophelia.  Besides the ocassional hop on the two platforms to cross the chasm parts platforming only means that game is 2D sidescroller - emphasis is on the puzzles. Which are a little too obscure, and the contols are not helping either - rotating parts are not accurate enough, a puzzle about totem parts the parts are movable sideways, while the upper downs fall down - so physics exist(falling) and don't (just picking out a middle-bottom part) at the same time.  It's just unintuitive at many times which makes the game annoying.  
 And that doesn't help that each of the levels ends with just walking up to the tree and next level / ending happens. The game has really nice looking graphics, but it's just an unintresting stroll through weird, unrewarding puzzles, a few instantly killing traps into an ending that's just as unrewarding

author: {'steamid': '76561198061737345', 'num_games_owned': 788, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1440884224}
review:
Absolutely not worth full price. It's a maybe on sale.

My Steam playtime for the game [i]was a complete playthrough[/i] of the game.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Art style - Many will have already mentioned this, but the art in this game is pretty much eye candy in places.
[*]Unique mechanics - At least, somewhat unique. The ability to take control of two characters with different abilities is no new concept, however it is isn't implemented badly here.
[/list]


[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Controls - One word: frustrating. There is one jumping section in the game which took me far more attempts than it should have due to the clunky nature of the controls. 
[*]Length - It's a short experience, and I'm not implying that's always a bad thing. It just is here. Unfortunately, Tulpa ends up feeling more like a glorified flash game.
[*]Puzzles - They're cryptic as hell in some places.
[/list]

I can't recommend this game, at least not at its retailing pricepoint. You'd possibly get more or less the same experience watching gameplay of it on YouTube. Only buy if [i]heavily[/i] discounted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062969105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1440967542}
review:
Tulpa, c'est la rencontre confidentielle entre Limbo et Ico, un rendez-vous galant entre deux pointures du jeu vidéo labellé "indépendant", et qui s'en approprie autant les belles qualités que les crispants défauts. Aussi discret que surréel, ce tête-à-tête muet (et presque silencieux) aligne les visions de cauchemars (superbes et poétiques, même lorsqu'elles se font dérangeantes), les aplats de couleurs mouvants, les contrastes en ombres chinoises, avec un sens de la mesure et une élégance qui mettent du baume aux pupilles.

On y guide deux âmes en souffrance sur les chemins sinueux de l'Enfer, du Purgatoire ou de la Rédemption, on leur tend la main comme ils se la tendent eux-mêmes, on les accompagne, une incarnation après l'autre, sur une voie parsemées d'embuches qu'ils surmonteront ensemble. Au joueur de deviner l'intrigue empêtrée derrière les symboles, le fond au-delà de la forme. D'interpréter. De décrypter. Et il aura fort à faire, le bougre, pour remettre ces pièces si hétéroclites dans le bon ordre.

Dans le même temps, il résoudra les énigmes qui jalonneront sa route d'essais, d'erreurs et de recommencements, il pestera face au caractère approximatif de certains contrôles et déplorera la brièveté de l'expérience (compter une à deux heures, pas plus). Mais en contrepartie, il aura pu vivre une authentique expérience artistique, et traverser de superbes tableaux animés qu'il n'oubliera pas de sitôt.

review: Hard for me to critic such games so I will not. I realize it's just a platformer at it's core but style and visuals here are so unique! Most of the deaths are unavoidable because it's pretty random. "Puzzles" are not actualy puzzles - it's trial and error. You are not given any rules or hints most of the time, it's just trying this or that. Chances are you couldn't beat the game without the walkthrough. Game is very short if you know what to do, 1-2 hours. Maybe price is too high for such playtime but give it a try on some sale. I guess it even has some replayability not because of the gameplay but because of such unique visuals which makes you want to see it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006541362', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1453909878}
review:
You control Ophelia and her tulpa Oliver as they travel through several weird worlds and solve puzzles using the tulpa's ability to manipulate objects from a distance.
Tulpa is a short puzzle game with a pretty great art style and atmosphere that sadly falters when it comes to actual gameplay and content: while the care that went into the game is plain to see its simple nature and extreme shortness make the asking price hard to justify.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-great art style 

-the soundtrack is subtle but pretty effective

-the worlds you cross are all fascinating due to how weird and eerie they feel

-some puzzles are interesting

[b]CONS:[/b]

-very little in the way of story, what can be gleamed from visual cues is extremely vague

-controls can feel a bit unresponsive at times

-some puzzles and sections rely too much on blind trial error, also a few puzzle elements can be hard to make out from the background

-very short, expect around 90 minutes

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=609624428

I really like Tulpa's art style, it's simple yet very effective in representing strange and somewhat disturbing worlds from another reality: sadly that's pretty much all there is to the game though. The gameplay is very light fare as you simply walk around- or face basic jumping sections- and face a few puzzles for each level.

The aforementioned puzzles go from ok to annoying as some are quick, logical affairs while others rely on clues or visual cues that can be a bit hard to get and either leave you stumped or require several deaths to pass successfully. It's a quite forgettable experience most of the time and the extreme shortness'd doesn't help either.

All things considered Tulpa is worth a playthrough for the art style and atmosphere alone if, like me, you got it from a bundle: but its price tag and bland gameplay aren't enough to recommend as it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042838346', 'num_games_owned': 5513, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1498254647}
review:
[i]Une "tulpa" est une entité spirituelle qui nous vient tout droit de la mythologie tibétaine. Créée par un invocateur, cette entité imaginaire se manifeste dans le monde réel à partir de la simple volonté psychique de cette personne. Avec son jeu sobrement intitulé Tulpa, le studio Encryptique désire nous faire voyager dans des lieux mystiques où la frontière entre le réel et l'imaginaire est mince.[/i]

Après avoir invoqué Oliver, Ophelia se retrouve dans un monde surréaliste, aussi dangereux qu'il est envoûtant et aussi coloré qu'il est noir. La traversée s'annonce complexe et semée d'embûches mais Oliver dispose de pouvoirs lui permettent d'influer sur des objets distants et ainsi d'aider la jeune femme à atteindre sa destination.

Ophelia nous est d'emblée présentée comme une personne fragile. Certains lieux peuvent déclencher chez elle une crise de panique et seule la fuite lui sera de bon secours. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=608440674 De même, si Oliver s'éloigne trop d'elle, ses battements de cœur qui s’accélèrent nous feront ressentir sa peur et son angoisse d'être séparée de lui. En jeu il faudra donc toujours veiller à ne pas mettre trop de distance entre celle-ci et sa tulpa. 

Votre périple consistera en un enchainement de tableaux nécessitant la résolution d'une énigme afin de continuer à progresser. On aurait tord de penser qu'il s'agisse d'un platformer car les sauts à effectuer seront rares, c'est avant tout un jeu de puzzles et de réflexion. Ophelia peut tirer des objets vers elle tandis qu'Oliver [strike]se tape tout le boulot[/strike] peut déplacer des objets et actionner des mécanismes. Il est vraiment dommage qu'Ophelia ne soit pas plus sollicitée car elle devra se servir de sa capacité à tirer des objets uniquement par deux fois au cours du jeu (dont une lors du tutoriel). On en vient même à oublier qu'elle sait faire quelque chose d'autre que stresser si Oliver, qui bosse, lui, s'éloigne trop d'elle. Aussi, ses crises de panique devant certains lieux sont oubliées dès la fin du tutoriel, il n'y aura plus qu'Oliver qui compte alors quel intérêt de nous introduire un élément de jeu qui n'existe que dans le-dit tutoriel ?

Les puzzles sont variés allant du très simple au plus alambiqué. Étant donné que l'on se trouve dans un monde qui ne répond pas aux règles du monde réel, on tâtonne toujours un peu en recherchant quels sont les objets que l'on peut utiliser. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=608440866 Oliver peut influer sur les éléments blancs, mais pas tous. Le jeu manque un peu de réaction dans ces moments-là, on aurait aimé avoir un petit feedback lorsqu'on touche des objets afin de savoir si on peut les utiliser. Là, on garde un peu le sentiment que le monde reste assez statique et imperméable à nos actions. 

Ce qui est dommage aussi, c'est que le jeu nous entraine dans des lieux si étranges que souvent ce n'est pas la difficulté des puzzles qui nous empêchera de progresser mais simplement notre incompréhension du monde qui se trouve face à nous. Parfois, c'est en essayant des choses dans tous les sens qu'on va réussir à passer un puzzle, sans même en comprendre la signification. Je pense notamment à un moment du jeu qui nous montrait deux glyphes suivis par un point d'interrogation. Devant nous, trois cordes qu'il faut couper. Je n'ai absolument pas compris ce qu'il fallait faire avec ces glyphes mais les cordes se sont coupées lorsque j'ai cliqué dessus, au hasard. C'est décevant de ne pas comprendre réellement ce qui se passe en ces lieux où l'on rencontre d'étranges créatures et où l'on essaye de chercher des indices pouvant aider à notre compréhension de l'histoire.

Lors de ce voyage empreint de magie, on contrôlera les deux personnages en switchant avec Z. Enfin en théorie car comme il n'y a pas de rebinding des touches vous devez passer en clavier QWERTY, puis utiliser W pour switcher. On ne va pas parler de la touche X qui sert à tirer des objets puisqu'on va uniquement l'utiliser de manière anecdotique mais ce W juste placé sous les touches qui servent à nous déplacer reste un choix illogique qui entrave à la jouabilité. Il parait, d'après le forum, que l'on peut utiliser les touches directionnelles au lieu des touches WASD pour se déplacer, une info que j'ai eu trop tard mais qui vous sera peut-être utile à vous. 
Lorsqu'on contrôle Oliver, le jeu passe en mode point & click en nous offrant un pointeur par le biais duquel on va pouvoir cliquer sur les objets. Malheureusement il n'existe pas d'options relatives à ce pointeur et on aurait aimé pouvoir augmenter sa sensibilité afin d'avoir des déplacements plus fluides. Aussi, faites attention en cliquant sur "Jouer" car sur l'écran suivant votre pointeur sera placé sur "Nouvelle partie" et non sur "Continuer", un coup à effacer sa partie d'un clic !

Si on déplace Oliver, Ophelia le suit alors il faut prêter attention à ne pas l'entrainer dans un gouffre. En fait, on meurt assez fréquemment dans Tulpa, à cause de bêtises de ce genre mais aussi parce qu'on va souvent se rendre compte qu'il y a un puzzle devant nous une fois que l'on aura essayé d'avancer et qu'une créature nous aura stoppés en nous tuant. Ce n'est pas un jeu punitif non plus, on va quasiment toujours réapparaitre devant le puzzle sur lequel on a buté.

Au niveau visuel, Tulpa est minimaliste et fonctionne avec des décors noirs sur fond coloré. C'est vraiment à ce niveau-là que le jeu retient toute notre attention tant le côté étrange et mystérieux des lieux nous intrigue. Au fur et à mesure de notre progression, les décors féériques du début laissent place à une imagerie noire et glauque qui opère comme une lente plongée dans un cauchemar. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=608441199 Le jeu est indéniablement très réussi sur ce plan-là mais il manque tout de même quelque chose : l'ambiance sonore reste trop timide. Les bruitages sont bons mais il manque une atmosphère envoutante et mystique qui aurait permis une meilleure immersion dans cet univers.

Au final, Tulpa nous offre un voyage imaginaire et surprenant qui n'est pourtant pas exempt de défauts. De ses contrôles mal pensés à ses puzzles parfois trop éloignés de notre compréhension du monde en passant par sa bande-son trop pauvre, il n'est clairement pas parfait. Cependant cet univers est fascinant d'étrangeté, on prend plaisir à découvrir chaque créature qui le peuple et à essayer de comprendre comment il fonctionne. L'histoire des deux protagonistes reste complexe, tous les tenants et les aboutissants de leur relation ne nous sont pas livrés mais elle reste cependant forte et dramatique. Il faut vraiment jouer à Tulpa en souhaitant avant tout vivre l'expérience d'un voyage aux confins de l'étrange avant d'y chercher un jeu dans le sens commun du terme.

review:
You control two characters in Culpa, a girl who jumps and climbs (and even pulls things twice in the whole game) and a guy who basically exists to be a 'wormhole' liability and to let you point and click with your mouse. You switch between them with a keypress. It's a bit of a clunky mechanic. When in control of the guy, the girl will blindly walk off of cliffs to stay close to him. Most puzzles require you to find the magic thing to click on and interact with. Once you've identified that, the 'puzzle' is often just dragging something. The platforming controls are slow and sluggish and platforming itself never poses any real challenge. The game's art style is consistent and almost unique; it is a cousin of the "silhouette" platformer that's become so common as of late.

The game is very short and doesn't offer much to engage the player in terms of unique game mechanics or a gaming experience in general. I wouldn't recommend this to all but the most diehard of puzzle platforming fans. 5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972376743', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1446403362}
review:
There's an achievement early on in Tulpa, called "Could I have skipped this?". My answer to the game is yes, I could have skipped this, and watched a movie instead - it would've been better use of my time and money.

A mediocre game in the style of Limbo and many other recent atmospheric indie platformers, it vaguely hints at a tragic story with death and suicide imagery, but never elaborates. A shapeshifting tree and colour-changing background mark the major acts. Imagery is taken from a number of real-world religions and occult practices, but is never used meaningfully. There is more story in the Steam Cards than in the game itself. The art is at best sufficient for the tone and atmosphere, and at worst reminiscent of a 15-year-old pagan art student's sketchbook. The title of the game isn't even justified within the experience. The payoff is unsatisfactory and inconclusive.

The game mechanics are near identical to another, superior game which is itself average at best - Never Alone (Kisima Inŋitchuŋa), which had the decency to include narration, a good story and relatable characters, as well as a full documentary on the history and culture of its setting. The tutorial text offers more exposition than any of the non-sequitur and esoteric actions you have to perform to progress. The platforming is poor to downright inadequate, with sloppy physics objects that you click and drag to build bridges or click on, elements to interact with, but only when directly controlling the tulpa (often leading the host to her death if you move more than a little distance away from her). The host herself has simple push/drag abilities, which are still somehow made awkward through an unusual choice of key, and a jump which is prone to not working near the very same edges it is necessary to jump from in order to not fall, shatter, and be forced to repeat the simple drag-and-drop puzzle for the eighth time.

Strongly advise against playing this unpolished and lacking experience.

review:
通关撒花：守护之灵。

一款内容不多但却称得上精致的解谜小游戏，随着男女主人公的前进而展开一幅幅瑰丽的画面。画风猎奇，但却不失艺术感。

游戏有即时存档，流程不算太长。操作简单：shift切换男女主人公，ctrl和环境互动，space跳跃。剩下的，就是作者让人叹为观止的脑洞，每一个谜题都有着丝丝缕缕的线索，等待有心人去发掘。

这是一个充满奇思妙想的世界，推荐入手。

author: {'steamid': '76561198085391069', 'num_games_owned': 1318, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1445855986}
review:
Yaklaşık 2 saatlik oynanışa sahip bir bulmaca oyunu. Oyunda büyük bölümde iki kişi olarak hareket edeceksiniz. Bayan karakter insan ve zıplayıp, nesneleri çekip itebiliyor. Erkek karakter ise bir ruh ve uçup nesneleri uzaktan hareket ettirebiliyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961951106', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 1, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1444563653}
review:
Tulpa combines the "artsy platformer" direction of Limbo with the colour-coded, progressively more disturbing worlds of Eversion. In terms of actual gameplay it has much more in common with the former, as the platforming elements are few and easy; it's more of a 2d walking (jumping) simulator. Instead, the core of the gameplay comes in the form of puzzles to solve. These too, however, aren't very difficult.

No story is directly told and the player is left to interpret the clues on what happened as they see fit. Like Tengami, it is meant as an atmospheric journey, but where Tengami is meant to be serene, positive, maybe even joyous, Tulpa is the opposite. The audio and video do a good job of furthering the depressive atmoshpere.  

The game is extremely short, maybe just a bit over an hour for an experienced puzzler. It is also quite buggy. In one puzzle I immediately guessed the solution, but because of the wonky controls I was led to believe this solution is wrong and spent a lot of time looking for alternatives. Controller support doesn't work very well for me, which is disappointing.

Overall I find it definitely unworthy of the 10 euro asking price. Should be 2 euros tops. Since I got it from a bundle, however, I can skip over this objection and award a "thumbs up", although a weak one.

review:
Según la descripción, estamos ante un plataformas de puzles. (Por cierto, puzle en [strike]español[/strike] castellano es con una sóla "z").
Visto lo visto, en la época en la que estamos a cualquier cosa lo consideran "plataformas".

Y en cuanto a los rompecabezas. son más bien flojillos y facilones.
No cabe duda de que en alguno nos atascaremos un rato, pero en una primera instancia no tardaremos más de 2 horas en finalizar la historia.
El resto, para obtener los logros, cromos, comprender un poco más la historia y capturar unas cuantas imágenes.

Lo bueno que tiene este juego es la historia, los oníricos escenarios y una música muy bien acoplada.

De la historia no quiero contar mucho y así, si depués de todo decides adquirir el juego, podrás sacar tus conclusiones.
[spoiler]Chica feliz pierde a novio. El dolor por su perdida hace que vuelva en forma de espíritu y la acompañe en su camino hacia la desesperación y locura.[/spoiler]
Sólo diré que estoy seguro de que si llevaran 10 años casados, estas cosas no pasaban.

Y sin duda, lo más destacable son los escenários.
Líneas simples pero cargadas de fuerza e interpretabilidad.

Como juego yo no lo recomendaría porque es muy básico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072117155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1431662310}
review:
I am torn on whether or not to recommend this game. 

Personally, the biggest perk from this game is its atmosphere. How beautiful and artful it is comes in a close second, however. The imagery is fantastical. I loved the colors and how each level centralizes (or tries to anyway) around a certain theme and color. I found that the character breaking into shards of glass when dying was interesting and the entire concept of what a tulpa is. The visuals and the atmosphere of this game is the most fascinating and enjoyable aspect this game has to offer.

On the other side, this game has some hefty cons. It is incredibly short. One playthrough takes roughly about an hour to get through (this is coming from someone who gets stuck on the simplest of puzzles). The ending is very abrupt and unexpected with no real plot involved - unless I am perhaps too vague to understand the depth that is presented in the surreal imagery. There does appear to be a hint of a story underlying the imagery, but after spending my time going through multiple playthroughs I simply cannot fathom what I am missing. With so much to look forward to regarding the imagery and the atmosphere I was hoping for at least five levels to go deeper into the concept of a "tulpa" (which is a fascinating concept on its own and I did not feel as though it explored this idea at all). I was, admittedly, very disappointed with the abrupt ending as I was enjoying the game up until then. I had expected a lot more from it. 

Regardless of its hefty con ... it is worth playing in my opinion, especially if you enjoy atmospheric games with lots of imagery. I would wait until it was on sale to purchase, though.

review:
It's hard to safe weather or not I like this game...

It's got some great art in it and it does deliver a haunting atmosphere. However, a lot of the puzzles are either hard to figure out of you just walk past them going, "I guess I solved it...". There's a couple of times where the rules of the game aren't stated that well either. For example, the game starts out telling that you can only interact with white objects and then at later points you can pick up black ones that blend in perfectly with the background. Additional, you will spend most of your time staying, “What killed me?!" and then feeling cheated when the solution was simple but not apparent. During another part the game introduced what was a vortex but in a small hallway so I never thought to move vertically because of how small the area was.

Anyways, if you played and really liked "Limbo", give it a try. It’s sort of dark/eerie slow paced puzzle platformer. Good art, not a good puzzle game.

Not my cup of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042023224', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 1032, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1443107393}
review:
미친 거 같다. 도대체 이런 흉물이 게임이라고 나왔다니......
림보 흉내내다 패망한 게임이라 생각하면 정확하다.

이 게임의 스토리텔링은 대단히 엉망이다. 화면 상에는 정체를 알 수 없는 기괴한 것들이 출현하는데, 이게 왜 나오는지 며느리도 모른다. 주인공 남녀(남매인지 애인관계인지도 모르겠다.)가 왜 이런 상황에 처했는지, 그들이 모험을 떠나는 과정에서 본 것이 무엇인지를 전혀 알려주지 않는다. 아무래도 여러 광경들을 추상적으로 보여주고 플레이어가 스스로 유추해보란 의미로 이렇게 만들어 둔 모양인가본데, 그렇게 보기엔 화면의 광경들이 너무 난잡해보인다.

실질적인 레벨 디자인은 절망적인 수준이다. 각 상황에서 우리가 무엇을 어떻게 해야할지 전혀 짐작을 할 수가 없다. 각 상황에 닥치면 그래서 무조건 헤메게 될 수밖에 없다. 별다른 힌트 없이 야생에 던져진듯한 느낌인데, 게임이 불친절해도 이렇게까지 불친절할수 있구나를 여실히 느끼게 된다. 이 쯤 되니 게임이 짧은 건 단점으로 취급하기조차 애매할 지경이다.

아무래도 사람들이 림보(LIMBO)란 게임을 너무 쉽게 생각하는 것 같다. 겉으로 보기엔 그저 단순하고 시꺼먼 플래포머 게임인 림보가 그렇게까지 흥할 수 있었던 이유는, 말 한 마디 없어도 플레이어들에게 충분히 공감을 줄 수 있는 시나리오의 전달 장치들과 아주 정교하고 세심하게 만들어진 레벨 디자인이 있었기에 가능했던 것이었다. 대충 분위기 어둡게 만들고 대충 플래포머 구색만 갖춰서 인기를 얻은 게임이 절대 아니란 말이다.

게임을 만드는 제작자가 있다면 이 게임을 훌륭한 반면교사로 삼기 바란다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142904979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1441652554}
review:
I feel bad marking this down, as there are several things I really liked about it. The atmosphere is wonderful, with a strong art style (let down by terrible animation on Ophelia, the main character) and a great soundscape. I actually really like that the story is a little obtuse, other than a clear Orpheus inspiration - although the Ophelia reference might imply it's all in her head, making the final bit doubly ambiguous.

I think there's two problems, basically. This is a mix of a platformer/side scroller and a puzzler. Unfortunately the platform bits are stymied by sluggish controls, especially affecting jumping. The puzzles are varied, some being fun and clever, some being obvious, and some being just plain weird. I solved several without actually understanding what the hell was going on or what I was doing. A lot of them are trial and error, and many are random pixel hunts, clicking all over the screen. I did, however, enjoy making the dead body of Jesus flail around like a ragdoll. Great corpse animation is a plus.

So, as an experience, this game is pretty decent; as a game, it fails. It really annoyed me on several occasions. I got this as part of a humble bundle, and I don't regret spending 23p on it, but if you can't get it that cheap think twice. Having finished it in under 2 hours, it's a bit annoying that none of my steam trading cards have triggered. If you've got a short game, don't add insult to injury by making people play it for ages just to get the cards!

All in all - this feels like a wasted opportunity, but makes a fascinating failure. I don't regret my time with Tulpa, but only just.

review: This game eschews clear puzzle design in favor almost arbitrary puzzles that have a tendency to immediately kill you. The challenge isn't so much "what to do" as "what am I even supposed to click on?" The control scheme doesn't help either: You switch between two characters, a presumably not dead girl, and her ghost boyfriend. The girl can push and pull certain objects, and the ghost can pick up and move objects and interact with distant switchs. Sounds good, right? Except the girl "dies" if the ghost gets too far from her, "too far" being "about 6 feet". To that end, she'll follow the ghost around, including right off ledges to her death. author: {'steamid': '76561198101362468', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 214, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1466007507}
review:
真不知道给这个游戏打好评的玩家是多么有耐心
这个游戏真心除了画面以外一无是处。操作简直碉堡了。一上来在toutrial就死了好几次。不是因为操作渣，而且因为这个游戏的很多操作与你认为的结果完全不一样
游戏的谜题设置也很恶心，非常多的地方没有任何提示，哪些是可以触碰的，哪些是不能触碰的，完全没有说明，就是靠你一遍遍死和猜。但是这个游戏的死不如I wanna系列纯粹，这个死要黑屏1秒，反反复复黑屏N个1秒。真是很让人恶心的事情。好多谜题一看就是作者自以为很聪明的设计，实际上在没有任何提示的情况下这种设计非常愚蠢。游戏完全没有解释什么会让女主死，也没解释什么会让男主死，反正你就走着走着发现有一个人死了，那就是这里有个谜题
这个游戏也是我见过最喜欢让玩家走回头路的游戏。
而且这个游戏也是一上来就出现设计矛盾的典型：最初的时候栏杆是可以走的，主角会跳下去，然后正常行走。但是20秒以后这种栏杆就会直接把主角扎成玻璃渣，真是醉了

============================================
这款游戏向我们完美地展示了如何让一款只有1小时流程的垃圾游戏硬生生变成3小时



绝对差评

author: {'steamid': '76561198062247697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1440244679}
review:
I'd totally remove the "puzzle" tag for this very, very short game.

Basically, this is a sidescroller with some obstacles, where you use one ghost-like character to reach and manipulate objects that the regular character cannot. The game sacrifices the logic in the name of the surreal flavour. Yes, this means "trial and error" most of the time. Like Hapland.

The controls are not horrible, as other people claim. Granted that using X and Z together with WASD movement is very awkward, but you can use Shift and Ctrl instead.

The atmosphere is great at some points, and just off in others. The "Ophelia is Distressed" thing in the first part was great, why did that stop? I was expecting more of that. Actually, I was expecting more of everything, the game is ridiculously short.

Only get this during a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986496984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1442787919}
review:
[i]„Ona a on.“[/i]

Malá, mrazivě krásná plošinovka, od řeckého studia Encryptique. Je hluboká noc, pod korunou mohutného stromu, v tichosti klečí mladá dívka. Hlavu má sklopenou, a zlaté vlasy jí padají do tváře, snad ve snaze zakrýt tu bolest a žal. Krásné černé šaty, obepnuté žlutou stužkou, smířlivě přijímají každou slzu z jejích očí. Šelest listí se jí snaží být útěchou, hřejivé světlo nedaleké lampy povzbuzením. Ona ví, že musí být silná, že musí jít dál. Pomalu se zvedá a nechává vánek osušit její zvlhlé tváře. Netuší co ji čeká, ani jak těžké to bude, ale je připravena vyrazit...

Jmenuje se Ophelia, a krátce po zahájení hry, se potká s Oliverem. Okolnosti jejich setkání ponechám v tajnosti, ale mohu vám prozradit, že se z nich stane nerozlučný pár. Má to svůj dobrý důvod, protože jeden bez druhého, by byl ve zdejším světě ztracený. Ona dokáže přesouvat objekty v těsné blízkosti, on zase pohybovat věcmi mimo jejich dosah. Na tomto principu, jsou pak postaveny všechny hádanky, na které v průběhu hraní narazíte. U těch prostorových, se snažíte umístit předměty tak, aby vám uvolnily cestu dál. Při těch logických, zase řešíte správné uspořádání daných prvků. Postěžovat si zde musím na přeskakovací pasáže, protože Ophelia se občas neodráží od okrajů, což dokáže být celkem frustrující.

Naštěstí to ale zachraňují dobře rozmístěné záchytné body, díky kterým nemusíte opakovaně procházet příliš dlouhé úseky. Za nejsilnější stránku hry, ovšem považuji její atmosféru a grafické zpracování. Každé kapitole, totiž dominuje vždy pouze jedna barva, s jejíž pomocí je tvořeno celé pozadí daného „světa“. Společně se všudypřítomnou černou, se autorům daří vytvářet tak úchvatné výjevy, že jsem často přestával hrát a jen se kochal. Skvěle zvolený je také hudební doprovod, složený z temných zvukových koláží. Neočekávejte ovšem nic dlouhého, závěrečné titulky uvidíte za necelé dvě hodiny.

Pokud si tedy chcete zkusit zajímavou plošinovku, s vynikajícím grafickým zpracováním, pak máte mé doporučení.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152590429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1434918171}
review:
Что я могу сказать о Tulpa? Неожиданная подача переработанной идеи, в основе которой лежит образ, взятый из буддизма — образ тульпы, — самовнушенной галлюцинации, достигаемой путем медитативных практик.
Вот многие эту игру ругают по разным причинам: мол, клон Limbo, сюжета нет, смысл передается вяло... На этот счет замечу, что в Limbo заложена совсем другая идея, потому все сходства заканчиваются лишь на геймплее. Сюжета в привычном нам понимании и правда нет, но есть логичная история, и со смыслом. Просто над ним придется подумать. 
Да, в этой игре вообще думать надо, в этом ее суть. А кому повезет с кругозором и духовным багажом, те еще и будут получать удовольствие от проводимых параллелей и аллюзий, благо игра ими изобилует. Причем самое прелестное тут то, что каждый увидит что-то свое.

Прекрасно передана гнетущая атмосфера нескончаемого галлюциногенного сюрреалистичного кошмара. Яркие цвета контрастируют с черным, и каждый из них несет в себе свой смысл. Раскрывается тема одиночества, дружбы (любви?), внутренней и внешней борьбы с окружающим миром.

Единственный минус для меня — игра достаточно короткая, но как долго ее проходить, зависит от скорости решения задач. 

Я ставлю знак «Рекомендую», но этим я подразумеваю, что игра мне понравилась. Я не могу ее рекомендовать всем и каждому. Игра очень специфична и многие просто ее не поймут. 
Любите пораскинуть мозгами? Любите сюрреализм? Тогда берите. Если цените в играх что-то другое — лучше воздержитесь от покупки.

review: Tulpa is a 2D puzzle platformer where you control two characters with different abilities. The girl can push/pull things and jump and the floating boy can interact with onscreen objects with the mouse cursor. If you've played Limbo you'll have an inkling of what you're in for, if not, that means that you will learn what to do by being killed, repeatedly. Some deaths are unavoidable the first time around. This aspect makes the game frustrating, especially coupled with the obtuse puzzles you'll have to solve. The puzzle-solving boils down to clicking any suspicious object on-screen to determine its utility. The unresponsive controls confound the puzzle-solving further, as there are instances where I knew what should be done, but the controls failed me. Despite the colorful presentation and surreal imagery, there is no story in this game. It is one of those games that throws as much weirdness at you and hope that your mind would probe for meaning, when there isn't any. If there was an underlying thread of meaning that ties up this adventure, it went way beyond me. Game duration is about 1-2hrs.

I would not recommend 'Tulpa'. 

As a game, it's not great. The keys used are WASD to move, X&Z for actions, and the mouse. This is pretty hard to play with, as moving my hand around to move while holding X [for example to move something] is extremey awkward, and the controls cannot be re-mapped.

The visuals in the game are nice, although I am missing any symbolism here, because I have no clue about the subject matter of 'Tulpas'. Nearer the end, the game starts to use some evangelion 3 level visuals which fit right in to the game, but I have no idea what they mean.

This is actually true for a lot of the game. There are many puzzles where I found the solution just by random chance, and some things are never really explained.

Perhaps if you like the subject matter you would enjoy the game, but i cannot recommend it for anyone who doesn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039086801', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1426986329}
review:
Un juego surrealista donde los personajes principales son Ophelia y Oliver, están en un mundo peligroso, lleno de obstáculos y retos que tendrán que enfrentar juntos.
Un personaje dependerá del otro y las habilidades de cada uno lograran poder completar este mundo misterioso.
Este mundo tan desafiante tiene un diseño hermoso y oscuro a la vez, el diseño de los gráficos, los efectos sonoros le dan un toque tétrico al juego pero una vez que lo juegues comprenderás muchas cosas.
Los controles son fáciles y me hubiera gustado que se pudiera cambiar la resolución en las opciones del juego.
A veces hay como pequeños errores en el juego como si no me funcionara las habilidades de Oliver, el tulpa, al mover un objeto o esperar que un objeto se moviera y no se mueve.

[b][i]En mi opinión es un juego asombroso con un diseño único bien desarrollado, me sorprende hasta dónde puede llegar Unity. 
Los gráficos y el sonido me encantan te hacen entrar en este mundo surrealista lleno de misterio, veremos cómo tendremos que evitar que Ophelia pierda su cordura.
Los controles son sencillos y tiene ese pequeño error que dije pero luego me encanta a este juego le daré un 9/10.[/i]

POSITIVO
+ Gráficos hermosos con efectos de sonido que le dan una atmósfera tenebrosa.
+ Diferentes desafíos que tendrán que superar.
+Los controles fáciles de usar.

NEGATIVO
-No hay opción para cambiar la resolución del juego. 
-Pequeños errores cuando controlas a Oliver nombrados anteriormente al mover diferentes objetos o cuando hay que esperar que un objeto se mueva.[/b]

review:
不気味だが何故か美しい、なのに不安定になってくるゲーム。
視覚と聴覚に訴えてくる不安定さが心地よく、かつ得体の知れない恐怖を与えてくる。
怖さと美しさの不協和音が癖になる雰囲気ゲー。


女の子のオフィーリアと、男の子（だが背後霊）のオリヴァーを操作してパズルを解きながら進む横スクロール形式のゲームです。
オリヴァーはオフィーリアが掴めないものを掴めたり、操作できたりと便利ですが、二人が離れすぎてしまうと死亡してしまいます。
パズルはほぼノーヒントで進みますが、大体が手探りで解を見つけられるのでそこまでストレスにはならないかと思います。
アクション性は薄いのでご了承ください。
※ジャンプが上手くいかない時はスペースキーを押しっ放しではなく、「ｯﾀｰﾝ!」と押すと上手くいきます

クリアまでのプレイ時間は短め。攻略を見ながら進むともっともっと速く終わるので、初見では自力で進むことをおすすめします。
どちらかというと雰囲気ゲーに近いので、高難易度を求める方には向かないと思います。
ホラーというよりは、ときたま配置されているトラップにびっくりする、くらいの感覚です。
（といっても、筆者はル○ージマ○ションで泣くくらいのビビりなので正直序盤は怖かったです）
ですが不気味な表現が多く、後半になってグロテスクな表現も多少あるので苦手な方はご注意ください。

ムービーやスクリーンショットにビビッと来たら買い、だと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198086151669', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1423743291}
review:
El tulpa es una construcción mental, un ente místico creado por un acto de la imaginación y de la voluntad, que adquiere consistencia física. Puede tomar la forma de un animal, un objeto, un edificio, un paisaje o un ser humano. Según el vajrayna, esto es posible porque el mundo, el universo entero, es un flujo de conciencia y, por lo tanto, no hay ningún fenómeno que exista fuera de la conciencia.

Encryptique es un pequeño estudio independiente afincado en Larisa, Grecia, una pequeña ciudad al este del país donde, entre otras cosas, murió Hipócrates. El proyecto lo forman dos estudiantes de ciencias computacionales y telecomunicaciones que responden al nombre de Nikoleta Margariti y Georgios Koutsikos respectivamente, y una música que se hace llamar Red Aura. Entre los tres, y con alguna ayuda externa han sacado adelante su primer título, Tulpa, un viaje entre el sueño y la realidad lleno de púzles que me ha dejado sentimientos encontrados.

Tulpa es la historia de Oplelia y Oliver, o mejor dicho, la historia de Ophelia y su Tulpa, Oliver, un espíritu creado a partir de la meditación de Ophelia que sin embargo parece haber existido realmente, o al menos así se puede interpretar. Esa es una de las palabras clave de Tulpa, la interpretación, y es que la obra de Encryptique se relaciona con el jugador a través de de la interpretación de éste, puesto que tanto los escenarios como la trama que nos presenta el título se asientan bajo un bello surrealismo del que no concede un respiro en ningún momento, ni siquiera al final.

Las motivaciones para acabar o siquiera continuar un juego son múltiples y variadas. Las mías personalmente suelen moverse entre la superación personal y el desarrollo de la trama. Rara vez aguanto una partida si ya he visto todo el gameplay y la trama no lleva a ninguna parte. Tulpa me ha puesto a prueba en este sentido y he de reconocer antes de continuar el texto que si he llegado hasta al final ha sido gracias a su extrema belleza y su corte duración. Esto no quiere decir que el juego sea ni mejor ni peor, simplemente que llegados a cierto punto sentía la necesidad de llegar a algún sitio (narrativamente hablando) y ese sitio resultó ser el final. A mi me vale, pero puede que a ustedes no, así que ténganlo en cuenta.

Contrariamente a lo que pueda parecer, los primeros minutos de Tulpa me maravillaron, es más, durante la primera media hora no paraba de pensar que si alguna vez hiciera un juego (eso no pasará, pueden retirar su pistola de mi sien) seguramente sería muy parecido a este. El juego se presenta con un control sencillo en el que ambos personajes deben colaborar para superar los diferentes rompecabezas y avanzar en la trama. Ophelia puede moverse a izquierda y derecha, saltar y arrastar cosas. Oliver por su parte tiene la capacidad de volar y mover ciertos objetos con, digamos, su mente. Si Oliver se separa demasiado de Ophelia ésta perderá la cabeza y ambos morirán, por lo que hay que cuidar la distancia entre ambos personajes.

La presentación de un mundo surrealista no significa que los puzles también deban serlo y aquí Tulpa cumple… Durante un rato. Al principio parece claro qué es lo que puede hacer Ophelia y qué es lo que puede hacer Oliver. Resolver el puzle consiste por tanto en descubrir la manera de hacerlo y realizarlo en el orden exigido. El problema viene según avanzas en la aventura y comienzan los puzles trampa, en los cuales te limitas a intentar tocar TODO lo que se ve en pantalla con el fin de adivinar con qué demonios puede interactuar cada uno de los personajes. A día de hoy hay dos puzles que no tengo ni idea de cómo los hice, y vale, nunca he sido especialmente brillante en nada, pero cuando miro muy fijamente la pantalla y entrecierro un poco los ojos suelo enterarme de las cosas y esto no pasó con Tulpa.

Si a unos puzles que no acaban de alcanzar el grado de satisfacción exigido le sumas un control que no se encuentra lo suficientemente depurado la cosa se vuelve ciertamente frustrante. Hay una zona en el tercio final de Tulpa en el que para avanzar hay que clavar unos ojos gigantes en unas lanzas para permitir que Ophelia salte entre ellos y los utilice de puente para sortear una más que segura muerte. El salto milimétrico requerido junto con una acción de salto que no responde todo lo bien que debería puede convertir este sencillo reto en una suerte de castigo divino para los protagonistas, viendo como mueren una y otra vez. Problema: el jugador ya no aprecia la preciosa ambientación, la curiosa historia entre los protagonistas y la turbadora y extrañamente relajante banda sonora. Sólo ve a una torpe Ophelia obligándonos a repetir quince veces el mismo tramo de escenario.

Todo esto es una verdadera lástima, sobretodo cuando el juego habría funcionado perfectamente sin necesidad de plataformeo ni salidas de tono por el estilo. Tulpa es la captura de imagen perfecta, sus protagonistas, los escenarios, su ambientación… Todo resulta absolutamente evocador, y esa perfecta conjunción de elementos exigía un gameplay que no sacara al jugador de este extraño mundo sino que le ayudase a sumergirse aún más en él. Quizás con este cambio la duración habría pasado de las aproximadamente dos horas que tiene actualmente a poco más de una, pero la experiencia hubiera resultado mucho más satisfactoria.

Tulpa es la relación perfecta de una noche. Su belleza es espectacular y destila misterio y encanto por cada uno de sus píxeles. Puedes disfrutar de él sin demasiado esfuerzo y en el momento en el que sus defectos comienzan a hacerse lo suficientemente evidentes como para pensar que quizás no deberías haberle dado tu teléfono tan rapidamente, desaparece y se acaba. Personalmente estoy deseando ver hasta dónde son capaces de llegar estos griegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078631236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1424060390}
review:
Сюрреалистичный платформер-головоломка про мальчика и девочку.
Минусы – За эту игру я голосовал на Greenlight’е и очень был рад купить её, когда она вышла. К сожалению, я ждал от Tulpa какого-то сюжета или особой философии, чего в итоге не получил. Сюжет тут отсутствует начисто, поэтому если Вы цените именно историю, то лучше обойдите эту игру стороной. Философию или какой-то смысл Вы может и найдёте в Tulpa, но это всё очень вяло отображено в игре. Присутствует какой-то лирический, любовный мотив, мотив привязанности людей друг другу, но это всё довольно слабо, хочется чего-то большего. Сразу вспоминается философия Amnesia: A Machine for Pigs – там она чётко прослеживается и даже опирается на что-то реальное. Тут такого увы нет. Хотелось бы заметить невозможность играть с геймпада – Вы конечно можете ходить и прыгать, подключив девайс к компу, но управлять Оливером и брать предметы Офелией у Вас не выйдет, придётся задействовать клавиатуру и мышь. Ну и – да простят меня все любители платформеров – незачем снова изобретать LIMBO. Серьёзно, игра достаточно сильно её напоминает, пусть и так же сильно отличается.
Плюсы – Всё же играть в Tulpa приятно. Очень красивый визуальный ряд просто радует на протяжении всей игры. Яркие краски отнюдь не вдыхают жизнь в игру, а наоборот делают её ещё мрачнее, а данный эффект дорогого стоит. Геймдизайнеры и художники на славу постарались – декорации и загадки впечатляют. Все четыре мира Tulpa довольно опасны и безжалостны, что видно уже по их внешнему виду и их обитателям. Загадки в игре интересно решать, а ещё интереснее на них просто смотреть. Управление с клавиатуры и мыши довольно удобное. Звуковое сопровождение тоже неплохое – мне например понравилась музыка в фиолетовом мире. В плюс игре также пойдут её мрачность и общая депрессивность. Офелия умирает, когда Оливер далеко улетает от неё, а с ней умирает и он. Эта метафора привязанности очень мило и уютно вписывается в геймплей, но в то же время становится довольно жуткой и какой-то неприятной для осознания деталью. Это мило, пускай и грустно!)) 
Итог – Вроде бы это клон LIMBO, к тому же не рассказывающий совершенно никакой истории, но в то же время игра довольно сильно впечатляет своим миром. Вы будто погружаетесь в чей-то кошмар. Но не в тот кошмар, от которого просыпаешься в холодном поту посреди ночи и кричишь, потому что тебя пытался утащить какой-нибудь Бабадук, а в кошмар, где реальность смешивается с какими-то подсознательными образами и ассоциациями, во всё это вмешивается Его  Величество Сумбур и Хаос, а в гости в Ваш сон приходит какой-либо близкий человек. Вот в такой кошмар нас и помещают в этой игре, как мне кажется. Несмотря на значительные минусы, игра оставила приятные впечатления!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001748570', 'num_games_owned': 1499, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1423838263}
review:
Tulpa is a 2D colorful puzzle platformer with a little bit of adventure in there. It's surreal, beautiful, charming, and you get a great half experience from it, the other half is frustration, which is surprising for me since barely any game does that to me.

The game is a damn beautiful art piece, which as vibrant colors, great art work that looks like it was inspired by a mix of Indian, Arabian, and English art. The puzzles are really simple and hidden so plainly that you'd just miss it somehow, and that's kind of what I think is makes (one version of) a good puzzle game.

The beginning section is annoying, along side with most of the game. I get what they're trying to do, adding a creepy/scary factor to it, but it's more annoying than being effectively creepy.

The controls/gameplay are less than solid work, sometimes frustrating, where there actions are delayed, moving objects around are noticeably laggy, and half of the time the character won't hold on to a ledge.

Tulpa is absolutely astonishing in the way that it looks, it's art is just fantastic, it's creepy factor is amazing, and the pacing of it is good too, the characters are also great with how one is working with the other to continue their adventure, but it's a shame that it has such low quality control in the gameplay side of things, which includes the platforming design, the controls, the interactions with items and the environment, the movement and jumping system, that and the guides/tutorials are bad or not even there to help sort out what you can do in the game, which I think they aren't there because of the shortness of the game? not sure.

I'm actually more disappointed that angry with the game, looking forward to it before release, and then finally playing the game, it did an amazing job in its looks, in the characters, in the puzzles, but not in the gameplay sadly, which is why I recommend this game only at a price cut, around 6 dollars is a good point, but if it didn't have those problems that ruined half of my experiences, then I would wholeheartedly recommend at full price, even if it is short 2-3 hour game, I'm more into a great experience rather than length, to an extent, and this Tulpa delivered half a good one.
